      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

      • NQueens

        public static void NQueens(int k,
                           int n)
        Determines where n queens can be placed on an n x n chess board with queens not allowed in the same column, row, or diagonal of another queen
        Parameters:
        k - Which queen from 0 to n-1 we are currently placing
        n - Number of queens

      • Place

        public static boolean Place(int k,
                            int i)
        Can the queen k be placed in column i
        Parameters:
        k - The queen we are attempting to place
        i - The column we are attempting to place her in
        Returns:
        True if allowed, false if it would break the conditions

      • PlaceNew

        public static int PlaceNew(int k,
                           int i,
                           int n)
        Determines the next available column to place the queen or -1 on none found
        Parameters:
        k - Which queen we are placing
        i - Which column to start looking at
        n - Number of columns
        Returns:
        The index of the next available column

      • NQueensNew

        public static void NQueensNew(int k,
                              int n)
        Determines where n queens can be placed on an n x n chess board with queens not allowed in the same column, row, or diagonal of another queen This version is optimized by not iterating solutions that are mirror images of previous versions. This is done by only iterating over half of the first queens possible sets 0 to Ceil( n / 2)
        Parameters:
        k - Which queen from 0 to n-1 we are currently placing
        n - Number of queens

      • printArray

        public static void printArray(int[] array)
        Print the queen array as n x n with the number where the queen is placed and '-' where no queen is placed.
        Parameters:
        array - n length array of queen data

      • printLine

        public static void printLine(int[] array)
        Print the array in a line separated with spaces
        Parameters:
        array - n length array of queen data
